key_points: The Buccaneers' initial 2021 53-man roster includes just 10 newcomers.
Coach Bruce Arians favored linebackers over defensive backs, ending up with 10 linebackers on the team.
Six out of the seven 2021 draft picks made it to the roster, excluding seventh-round cornerback Chris Wilcox.
Jose Borregales, the only undrafted rookie, is on the roster as a kicker.
Notable players include Tom Brady, Giovani Bernard, Leonard Fournette, Antonio Brown, and Rob Gronkowski among others.
Rookie Kyle Trask is retained as a potential successor to Tom Brady.
Cameron Brate, Rob Gronkowski, and O.J. Howard are the tight ends, with Brate and Howard coming off injuries.
The defensive line is expected to expand with Ndamukong Suh's activation from the COVID list.
Outside linebacker Joe Tryon-Shoyinka, a first-round pick, deepens the edge rotation.
Specialists include newcomer Jose Borregales, with Ryan Succop expected to return from the COVID list.
